DOC.HEAD: Governor Having Surgery Today
Eds: SUBS 2nd graf pvs to RESTORE dropped `be.'
DOC.TEXT: Gov. Rose Mofford awaited surgery today to remove her gallbladder. The 67-year-old Democrat had been admitted to the cardiac unit at St. Joseph's Hospital and Medical Center with chest pain Sunday, but tests found no heart trouble, doctors said. Instead, she was found to be suffering from a gallbladder attack and gallstones. The operation, which could last up to three hours, was to begin around noon, said Dr. Victor Zannis, her surgeon. He said there is ``over a 90 percent chance that she's going to be just fine'' and that the average hospital stay after the operation is seven to 10 days. The hospital said the governor was in stable condition and had slept well. Dr. Michael Altman, a gastroenterologist, said she was in some pain. Mrs. Mofford's doctors said they didn't know what caused the attack but that her family had a history of gallbladder and heart problems. Arizona's first woman governor had been secretary of state for 31 years when she succeeded Republican Evan Mecham in 1988 upon his impeachment and removal by the Legislature.
